text:
2005/10/17 14:31:34 ERROR - jmeter.control.IfController: missing ; before
statement SyntaxError: missing ; before statement (<cmd>; line 1)
	at org.mozilla.javascript.NativeGlobal.constructError(NativeGlobal.java:597)
	at org.mozilla.javascript.TokenStream.reportSyntaxError(TokenStream.java:1324)
	at org.mozilla.javascript.Parser.reportError(Parser.java:73)

The condition was 

"${__property(${nextTopic})}" != "done"

This was inside a foreach element where the nextTopic was the output variable
name of the foreach element. The overall logic was a tweak to the foreach sample
but this logic was checking to see if the url had already been visited.
creator: martin.2.west@bt.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
This is by design.

JMeter deliberately does not use the GUI to report runtime errors.
